Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice place, terrible service, actually unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanDiversity
Reviews.Content: Creative, small, new and centrally located but not at all professional in how the place is run. Thatâ€™s the in-a-nutshell-summary for Pera Art Suites in Instanbul near Galata Tower. The place is a bit difficult to find when you first go there as most maps locate the address wrongly. Once you arrive, the team will be very friendly and helpful. However, when you are in need of some services, it will get difficult. The location is just perfect to explore Galata/Pera but also the metro and trams are just a few minutes away. I recommend this area over the â€˜old townâ€™ where you can just go for your sightseeing â€“ Galata is the place to go out, have dinner and drinks. Rooms are relatively large and include a kitchenette but without any pots or pans, so you canâ€™t use it. Breakfast is served in the rooms (upon your call in the morning) and is a sad plate of assorted bites. Furniture and bathroom are all modern and great. The lower the floor, the less light or let alone view you will get (as usual, but here this is even more true). Donâ€™t expect any service at Pera Suites. I had booked an (overpriced) transfer to the airport which was not there on time. They had required me to pay that in Euro but could not provide change in Euro (bills) so I refused â€“ just as they had refused to change back some of my remaining Turkish Lira in Euros. When I cancelled the cab based on all the inappropriate conditions, they starting yelling at me so I left (and would not go back).

Reviews.Title: “Pera Suites a good idea, but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: SamWoodward
Reviews.Content: Our Old Town hotel was not memorable, so I wonâ€™t mention it. But when we returned from the coast, we moved across the Galata Bridge and up the hill to a hotel in the New Town, a block from Istiklal Street, in a happening district with lots of interesting restaurants. Hotel: Pera Suites MeÅŸrutiyet Caddesi Orhan Adli Apaydin Sok. No:17/A TepebasÄ± 34430 +90 (212) 252 50 50 info@theperasuites.com infoATtheperasuitesDOTcom â€ƒ www.theperasuites.com We stayed in a Junior Suite, which is a studio apartment with small kitchen. The price was reasonable and the location excellent with restaurants, bars and clubs and small shops close by (Pera Suites are a block from the famous Pera Palace Hotel if youâ€™re looking on a map). The area is lively at night and even though the windows are double-paned, there is a hole in each for ventilation, so every word (and shout and late night song) rings clear. It helped to block the vent hole with pillows and to run the air con for white noise. The other challenge at Pera Suites is language (if you donâ€™t speak Turkish). The staff are very friendly and want to be helpful, but they have limited English and arenâ€™t able to assist with directions or information or recommendations. But they try their best! We recommend the place, especially if you are noise-tolerant (or are usually out making noise).

Reviews.Title: “Good ratio confort/price”
Reviews.Author: Sergio19
Reviews.Content: One blok far from Istiklal street. Good breakfast maybe too tukish with a good selection of cheses.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nemanja1
Reviews.Content: I have spend two nights in Pera Suites, and I was very happy with service and the rooms. Hotel is in excellent location, just few minutes walk from famous Istiklal Street. In this hotel you have the feeling that you are at home, because of the warmness and kind hospitalty that you feel every minute of your stay in this place

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Spirit2809
Reviews.Content: Back today from 3 nights at the Pera Suites hotel. 1. Nicely located next to many many small coffee shops ad excellent restaurants. Artsy little streets , seating outside, very very nice 2. Located very very close to the Itzalal shopping street. 3. "change" is very close on Itzalal st. 4. Room was ok, a little "tired" but fine. Do not agree to a room on first floor - you will not sleep - point!!! 5. wireless free - excellent 6. Great breakfast - vegetable, lots of cheeses. Caution - we asked for hot cecolate and turkish coffee and we were debited for it. My friend had to pay almost 50 eyors for her turkish cofffees. sh woudl not and she didnt finally. so ask if it's with breakfast or not.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: hsal
Reviews.Content: WE had a great stay at the Pera Suites. We found the hotel by chance while walking through the neighborhood. The entrance is nothing special (and the elevator is tiny!) by the rooms r spacious and it was great as we were have 2 children. The location is great as there are numerous restaurants in the area and Istiklal Caddesi is a block away. Old cily was justa short taxi ride away across the Golden Horn. Would definitely recommend it for people with small children who don't want to spend a fortune on renting 2 rooms at a hotel or trying to squeeze into one to save some $!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELENT”
Reviews.Author: silviawr
Reviews.Content: The location is excelent, as the rooms and the service. Hope we will come back some time. Don't miss it !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: US_in_UKLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite at the Pera Suites and absolutely loved it. It was like staying in someone's gorgeous one-bedroom apartment in a fun neighborhood of Istanbul. We seemed to get much better rates than others did (half the 310 that I'm seeing posted) -- not sure why our rate was so cheap. I usually don't spend much time in the hotel because I want to be out sightseeing, but this time I was happy to spend hours just relaxing in our suite. Most tourists would probably be happier staying in the Sultanahmet area, near all the tourist attractions, but we really liked being in an area with good restaurants (Soflaki 9, Galata House) and more of a nightlife. Walking to Sultanahmet took about half an hour, but we really like walking; for others, this might be exhausting. There also seems to be a lot of construction going on in the area, which was quite noisy. It didn't bother us, but we're heavy sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy...didn't get a single good night's rest”
Reviews.Author: LondonBlob
Reviews.Content: The room was pleasant , clean and comfortable however, due to live music being played in the restaurant below on Friday and Saturday night I got very little sleep. The music was unnecessarily loud. On top of this, directly opposite Pera Suites is an extremely noisy restaurant which also plays live music. There is live music EVERY night starting at 11 pm and not finishing until 5am. If you are planning to stay at Pera Suite my advice is BRING EARPLUGS!! I have to say the noise really ruined my stay.

HotelInfo.Name: The Pera Suites
HotelInfo.Address: Mesrutiyet Caddesi, Orhan Adli Apaydin Sok. No:17 | A Tepebasi, Istanbul 34430, Turkey
